## utils.style namespace

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [getBorderBox(element)](./blockly.utils.style.getborderbox.md) | Gets the computed border widths (on all sides) in pixels Copied from Closure's goog.style.getBorderBox |
|  [getCascadedStyle(element, style)](./blockly.utils.style.getcascadedstyle.md) | Gets the cascaded style value of a node, or null if the value cannot be computed (only Internet Explorer can do this).<!-- -->Copied from Closure's goog.style.getCascadedStyle |
|  [getComputedStyle(element, property)](./blockly.utils.style.getcomputedstyle.md) | Retrieves a computed style value of a node. It returns empty string if the value cannot be computed (which will be the case in Internet Explorer) or "none" if the property requested is an SVG one and it has not been explicitly set (firefox and webkit).<!-- -->Copied from Closure's goog.style.getComputedStyle |
|  [getContainerOffsetToScrollInto(element, container, opt\_center)](./blockly.utils.style.getcontaineroffsettoscrollinto.md) | Calculate the scroll position of <code>container</code> with the minimum amount so that the content and the borders of the given <code>element</code> become visible. If the element is bigger than the container, its top left corner will be aligned as close to the container's top left corner as possible. Copied from Closure's goog.style.getContainerOffsetToScrollInto |
|  [getPageOffset(el)](./blockly.utils.style.getpageoffset.md) | Returns a Coordinate object relative to the top-left of the HTML document. Similar to Closure's goog.style.getPageOffset |
|  [getSize(element)](./blockly.utils.style.getsize.md) | Gets the height and width of an element. Similar to Closure's goog.style.getSize |
|  [getViewportPageOffset()](./blockly.utils.style.getviewportpageoffset.md) | Calculates the viewport coordinates relative to the document. Similar to Closure's goog.style.getViewportPageOffset  The page offset of the viewport.  Blockly.utils.style.getViewportPageOffset |
|  [isRightToLeft(el)](./blockly.utils.style.isrighttoleft.md) | Returns true if the element is using right to left (RTL) direction. Copied from Closure's goog.style.isRightToLeft |
|  [scrollIntoContainerView(element, container, opt\_center)](./blockly.utils.style.scrollintocontainerview.md) | Changes the scroll position of <code>container</code> with the minimum amount so that the content and the borders of the given <code>element</code> become visible. If the element is bigger than the container, its top left corner will be aligned as close to the container's top left corner as possible. Copied from Closure's goog.style.scrollIntoContainerView |
|  [setElementShown(el, isShown)](./blockly.utils.style.setelementshown.md) | Shows or hides an element from the page. Hiding the element is done by setting the display property to "none", removing the element from the rendering hierarchy so it takes up no space. To show the element, the default inherited display property is restored (defined either in stylesheets or by the browser's default style rules). Copied from Closure's goog.style.getViewportPageOffset |
